Dinobot had ignored the earlier snickering. He transformed to raptor
mode a=
nd followed Kup and Rodimus as they tracked Trelos.

Dinobot: That prisoner=
 looks... viral. It's as if there's a glitch in
his processors. His reasoni=
ng patterns seem illogical from the
decisions he made... If you two want, I=
 can attack him in close combat.

--- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, Richard Al=
len <roborick007@...> wrote:
>
> ::Rodimus Prime/Kup::
> 
> Rodimus and Kup=
 follow Perseus dpwn the hall after the escaped Predacon.
> 
> Kup: If I ge=
t a firing solution I'm taking it.
> 
> Kraftlos <kraftlos@...> wrote:     =
                            
Salveo and the troopers rush to the first part=
ition which separated
the command center hallway from the more open entranc=
e area.  He
walked up to the wall and pulled open a hatch, revealing a manu=
al
crank for the doors.  As they turn the crank, the door slowly lowers
int=
o the closed position. 
> 
> "He wont be getting out this way!" shouted one=
 of the troopers
confidently as they moved to seal off the armory next.
> 
=
> Meanwhile...
> 
> Having been given orders to return to base, he decided =
that he had
better find a way out of the base. 
> 
> "AGGGGGGGG!" he shoute=
d as the door to the secret exit shuddered. 
After a second and third blow,=
 the door was off and was blown about 50
feet from the door frame.
> 
> As =
Trelos took off down the corridor, Perseus finally managed to get
the door =
open to the lower section.  He could immediately see that
Trelos had taken =
the not-so-secret exit-way.  With no power to the
forcefields, it was a sim=
ple matter of running.  He looked into the
security office and saw the guar=
d laying unconscious or perhaps dead. 
> 
> "Perseus to all personnel.  The=
 prisoner appears to have escaped out
the lower exit.  We need to catch him=
 before he reaches the city." he
said into the radio, then taking off down =
the passageway.  "Kenzo, we
have one guard in need of attention, he appears=
 to have been attacked
by the prisoner." 
> 
> 
> On 8/8/07, Kraftlos <kraf=
tlos@...> wrote: Trelos snarls and scrapes
half the metal off a support bea=
m which is over the doorway leading to
the room with the exit door and the =
door to the rest of the base.  He
then runs at the door leading to the upst=
airs and smashes into it,
however this time not causing as much damage. 
> =

> "HARRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRR!" he howled.
> 
> Meanwhile...
> 
> As Perseus tak=
es his first step down the stairs, he hears the door
being smashed, followe=
d by a blood-curdling howl. 
> 
> "Make sure Elita is out of harm's way.  I=
 believe that our prisoner
who murdered those policemen earlier, is back on=
 the loose," said
Perseus with a sigh. "He seems to have a perverse fascina=
tion with
killing...." 
> 
> "Hey dinosaur bones!  Wasn't this guy with you=
 Predacons?" said
Ravenchief with a slightly juvenile, but nevertheless acc=
usatory tone.
> 
> Meanwhile...
>  
>  Salveo jumps over the the security s=
ystem and sees the broken cell
bars and broken glass around Trelos' cell.
>=
 
> "That crazy dog-bot is on the loose again!" he said to Guardia. 
> 
> "=
Damn..." exclaimed Guardia, pulling out her shield and pistol, then
runing =
out the door and dowstairs where everyone else is. 
> 
> Salveo radio's the=
 guards at the front gate.
> 
> "Hey, we got an escaped prisoner, I'm going=
 to need your help
locking this place down.  The power's out!  Meet me in t=
he command
center."
>   
> "Rodger!"
>

iming, isn't it? How can I help?

ith me?"

ht.

ted the

ow he just broke and

ut that way.

w, landing on the unconscious guard.  In
several

room and
>  > walks freely into t=
he base.  He looks for a way out, or someone
to kill.
